column4: When Ubuntu is loading I get this error scrolling like 8 times:  modprobe : FAILED : could not load /lib/modules/2.6.11-6mdk/modules.deb no such file or directory          could this be why my USB mouse isn't working? ...what exactly is it anyways?
yea, that's probobly it... those are kernel modules that it isn't loading, similar to "drivers" for WinBlows
Ah, I thought they had to do with drivers... I've installed it twice and had the same error... is there a way to download modules.deb alone so I can stick it in?
hmm, not that I know of :/
crikey
out on a limb here, but do you think you could supply it? ....
sure, i'll look if I have one... but it might screw you up -- you're on x86 right?
yeah I am, but hey it's worth a shot :D
hmm, that dir doesn't exist... you're on ubuntu right ? :S
indeed, latest one too.. just d/led the ISO off the main site about 2 days ago
well mine definately won't work, we're using different versions of the kernel... i have 2.6.10 but you have 2.6.11
i see. thanks for the attempt..
np, i'm sure someone else has a 2.6.11 kernel if you want to try :/
I just mounted the ubunto drive to mandriva and searched and found modules.deb in /lib/modules/2.6.10-5-386    ...does that mean anything to you? :P
you found modules.deb on the ubuntu system, or the mandriva system?
ubuntu... but wait. it's .dep ...wtf is .dep? ...
LOL! no idea, but a .deb is a package -- whe you apt-get something, it downloads the .deb and isntalls it
yeah. this is weird :(
is .ko a driver file?
yea, that's a kernel module... same with .so and .o
ok. modules.dep is a text files full of paths to .ko files etc.
